note.p: Burial: Churchyard of Wyke St Mark, near Guildford, Surrey
Education: King's College, London; Inner Temple (1860)

Career: Called to the Bar (1863); went into business with his brother; MP for Greenwich (1880); Parliamentary Secretary to the Board of Trade (1885-1886); President of the International Conference on Sugar bounties (1887); Under Secretary for the Colonies (1888-1892); first Jewish Privy Councillor; prominent member of the Jewish community until his marriage
